comments.commentBody: Two things could have gone on here.  First, the Trump campaign worked with a hostile power, Russia, to undermine the integrity of our election.  Or second, Russia using vasts amounts of money bought favor with Republicans and the Trump campaign to undermine our election.  Either way you look at it, Trump is the accidental president.
Perhaps the GOP's reluctance to support an in-depth inquiry might be because they are worried what might come it and its possible impacts for the mid-term elections.

Even if Trump or his advisors met with Russian diplomats, that is NOT evidence of "election tampering".

Tampering would be hacking voting machines...using money or influence to buy votes...dumping or destroying votes...or stuff like turning a blind eye when illegal aliens vote, because you know they will vote for YOUR candidate.

If any of these thing were done, surely somebody would be investigating that? Rather than spinning their wheels trying to see "who met whom"?

I've met and talked to lots of people in my life, who did not in any way "influence me". Just chatting with someone does not prove "influence peddling".

Prior to November 8th....a Russian agent who believed that "Trump could win" had to be delusional, because Trump was way behind, had no newspaper endorsements and was widely predicted to lose a humiliating landslide defeat. Even his own CHILDREN warned Trump this was about to happen, and to brace himself.

So what made Russians so prescient and all-knowing? I have not heard ANYTHING that seriously proves any Russian involvement. If they DID figure out Trump would win....I guess they are smarter than the NYT and the entirety of the lefty liberal punditry.
The other real story is who is doing the massive leaking from our Intel Agencies. Low level or high level? This is a clue as to how close the investigations are to bringing down the administration.
but you forget that Hillary ' s popular vote win was all illegals...

Editors: and investigative journalists all should keep the Trump accusations in
mind...every hour of every day...

and the pronouncement of Donald J. Trump and his camp followers is that
the news media is the 'enemy of the people' clearly shows that Trump like
Putin like others who are and have been despots ...these suppressors of truth
want to destroy our truth seekers...those in news media who ...print the
truth...and not the distortions of the truth...; and therefore I hope that all
those employed by the NYTimes will call you the media out...if you dare
ever again to intentionally try to spin or distort the news...and defame your
fine predecessors...in this business...so no more spin..just the news that is
forever fit to print...remember your fine predecessors...or I will quit reading
your columns..

Absolutely NYT! This must be the only above the fold story until trump, Bannon and Pence are long gone. As far as Comey goes - orange pajamas for that traitor to the republic. And Obama? Thanks for nothing. I'm surprised you don't have arthritis from sitting on your hands all day.

Liberals were THRILLED and giddy with joy when the Billy Bush tapes were revealed -- even though they were 12 year old, PRIVATE conversations taped without the participants knowledge or consent.It "proved" Trump was a dirty old man.

Liberals were THRILLED and giddy with joy to get Trump's 1995 tax return -- with a $960,000,000 deduction on it! No matter it was perfectly legal and accepted by the IRS as a valid tax return. It "proved" Trump was an evil rich guy!

None of this, of course, worked to destroy Trump. Indeed, it backfired on liberals and made them look petty and venal.

When Edward Snowden and Julian Assange "leaked" information damaging to the Bush Administration, liberals were overjoyed. Now...not so much. Suddenly they HATE Wikileaks, where previously they often called for Snowden and Assange to get amnesty as "heroes".

Frankly, this all smacks of A. hypocrisy and B. poor sportsmanship. You lost, guys. Get over it.
Instructive lesson from past. Reagan and Iran-Contra. Reagan escaped  impeachment because it could not be proven he knew.

Sadly, so much of this can be traced back to Trump/GOP campaign self inflicted wounds. Refusing to provide tax returns, extremely controversial and in many cases unqualified appointments, "we won get over it" attitude from both Trump and his team, alternative facts, partisan overreach by congress on Clinton/Benghazi/emails, jumping to conclusions and policies based on radical Bannon ideologies, lack of any policy details during or after the campaign, maligning immigrants/judges/responsible press....I'd go on, but I'm tired of rehashing it all, but it does need to be pointed out as Trump has once again seen fit to blame others for his failures (the generals wanted the Yemen raid, it's a "WITCH HUNT").

It has now been driven to the point where only an independent special prosecutor can untangle the damage.....and the reason for that lies with the Trump team.....no one else.
Intelligence agencies were probably listening in, in many cases.
So meeting with a Russian Hasidic rabbi is a scandal now? Literally, Joe McCarthy didn't go as far as the NYT and WaPo are going in hyping hatred towards Russians.

Bill - That ship has sailed. Democrats have lost most Americans who voted for Trump, with the abuse they have heaped upon them for a year. And your point of view is one dimensional. You are suggesting that you have the only valid point of view and others do not, whom you have to persuade to your own position. Not a whole lot of humility in that position. Trumpism, defeated? What does that even mean? What the heck is Trumpism? Something you have made up and then attributed to 65 million people who voted for Trump with your own personal speculation and assumptions.

And what does it mean that his politics are bust? First of all, don't equate conservative values and policy positions, with Trump. He may have gotten elected because he had a handle on the underlying unhappiness of most conservatives in this country, but he certainly doesn't represent the essence of what most Americans were trying to accomplish. But the Democrats have policies that remain untenable. Whether Trump stays or goes. And the Democratic party that kept Nancy Pelosi in position and elected Perez and Ellison to head the party are so blind to their own faults that the very obvious hypocrisy of any Democrat suggesting the Democrats need to bring the country under it's control seems pretty self delusional.

And the more the country watches the organized, frenzied attack by what I can only guess are Clinton supporters, to imbed and dislodge the Trump administration... it's an ugly view.
Ding, ding, ding we have a winner! This times 1,000. The Russians have intel on Republicans and are just waiting to use it. First to go may be McCain and/or Graham.
EVERY person supporting a liar can't love the trueth very much..

I take your point but respectfully disagree. These are abnormal times. The removal of this criminal cabal from the apex of American power is the most urgent priority of our lifetimes, and by whatever means are necessary.  And the very fact that similar language was applied to President Obama proves how very wrong they are, how asymmetrical it all is. Just look at what they have done. When the smoking gun appears, it'll be about the money. But, if it does turn out to be something tawdry, I couldn't care less, as long it serves the purpose. It'll be the country's second-best day of my lifetime; best was still the day we elected President Obama. Never forget how much better we were on that day.

Hey Amy,
As a believer in lasting commitments (52 years ago my wife and I met -- a day I never fail to commemorate), and 19 years now with cancer in my system, beating the odds, etc -- I get how the big C can push you up against the wall and make you choose your life's definitive themes. You have obviously done so, and kudos to you.

Do not go gentle into that good night...

And please... one last Martini

Much love in your direction...
Lucky in love...blessed in life.
Best wishes for you to beat it!

My heart aches.

The love. The unselfishness.

Our world needs your kind.

More.
very well said.
If Sergey Kislyak is such a dark figure in Washington and suspected of spying, then why is he allowed to represent Russia in Washington?

Thank you, NYT! Keep going. You, and other courageous members of the fourth estate, are our only hope. Maybe our last hope. We the people can only be empowered by that which is uncovered. Don't fail us now.
When they lose their health insurance and all those manufacturing jobs don't appear they'll learn soon enough.

Then why do they lie?

Question if there was a meeting - deny.
Indications that there may have been a meeting - double down and deny.
Good proof that meeting occurred - deflect, demean and deny.
Irrefutable proof of meeting that finally sticks - "Oh, THAT meeting! It was nothing!"
Next Step:
Indicia of content of conversations - deny.
Good proof of meeting content - attack the leakers and everyone asking.
Irrefutable proof of treason against the United States - step down from new position.... Unless that position is a really good one, in which case, recuse yourself for now, but hang onto all the power you can, for as long as you can, and hope the American people will somehow become distracted and forget.

If a meeting was innocent, one does not deny the meeting took place.
